intro: Jaltomata incahuasina, commonly known as the Incahuasina morning glory, is a flowering plant native to the Andean regions of South America. It belongs to the nightshade family (Solanaceae) and is characterized by its striking, trumpet-shaped flowers that range in color from violet to white. The plant typically grows in rocky, mountainous terrain and thrives in cool, temperate climates. Its leaves are heart-shaped and covered in fine hairs, while its stems are woody and somewhat succulent. Jaltomata incahuasina is valued for its ornamental appeal and is often cultivated for its beauty and unique floral structure.
